article_title: Erroll Garner’s ‘Concert by the Sea’ Swings Anew
article_text: Without Will Thornbury, Erroll Garner’s “Concert by the Sea” would not have become one of the most beloved and best-selling jazz albums of all time. Thornbury was a recording engineer for the Armed Forces Radio Network on Sept. 19, 1955—the day the pianist performed for servicemen at Fort Ord near Carmel, Calif. When the concert began, Thornbury switched on his Ampex mono reel-to-reel tape recorder with plans to air the concert later...

twitter.description: Erroll Garner’s ‘Concert by the Sea’ has been remastered and is finally available in its entirety.
twitter.title: Erroll Garner’s ‘Concert by the Sea’ Swings Anew

article_metadata.article.origheadline: Erroll Garner’s ‘Concert by the Sea’ Swings Anew

article_summary:
When the concert began, Thornbury switched on his Ampex mono reel-to-reel tape recorder with plans to air the concert later...
Without Will Thornbury, Erroll Garner’s “Concert by the Sea” would not have become one of the most beloved and best-selling jazz albums of all time.
Thornbury was a recording engineer for the Armed Forces Radio Network on Sept. 19, 1955—the day the pianist performed for servicemen at Fort Ord near Carmel, Calif.
